fsRead.name: fsRead
fsRead.description:
A tool for reading files (e.g. `cat -n`), or listing files/directories (e.g. `ls -la` or `find . -maxdepth 2). The behavior of this tool is determined by the `path` parameter pointing to a file or directory.
* If `path` is a file, this tool returns the result of running `cat -n`, and the optional `readRange` determines what range of lines will be read from the specified file.
* If `path` is a directory, this tool returns the listed files and directories of the specified path, as if running `ls -la`. If the `readRange` parameter is provided, the tool acts like the `find . -maxdepth <readRange>`, where `readRange` is the number of subdirectories deep to search, e.g. [2] will run `find . -maxdepth 2`.

path.description: Absolute path to file or directory, e.g. `/repo/file.py` or `/repo`.

readRange.description:
Optional parameter when reading either files or directories.
* When `path` is a file, if none is given, the full file is shown. If provided, the file will be shown in the indicated line number range, e.g. [11, 12] will show lines 11 and 12. Indexing at 1 to start. Setting `[startLine, -1]` shows all lines from `startLine` to the end of the file.
* When `path` is a directory, if none is given, the results of `ls -l` are given. If provided, the current directory and indicated number of subdirectories will be shown, e.g. [2] will show the current directory and directories two levels deep.
